byline.original: By KAREEM FAHIM and C. J. CHIVERS
byline.contributor: Kareem Fahim reported from Cairo, and C. J. Chivers from the United States. Mark Mazzetti contributed reporting from Washington, and Shuaib Almosawa from Sana, Yemen.

abstract: Human Rights Watch reports Saudi Arabia-led military coalition in Yemen attacked market using bombs supplied by United States, leaving at least 97 civilians dead, including 25 children.
snippet: Human Rights Watch said it had found fragments of American-made bombs at a Yemeni market where at least 97 civilians died, including 25 children....

lead_paragraph: Human Rights Watch said it had found fragments of American-made bombs at a Yemeni market where at least 97 civilians died, including 25 children.

headline.main: Report Ties U.S. Bombs to Saudi-Led Strike That Killed Yemeni Civilians
headline.print_headline: Report Says U.S. Bombs Killed Scores of Yemeni Civilians in Saudi-Led Strike
